request_pathways.name: Authorization for Disclosure of Health Information

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patient must use a generic third-party authorization for disclosure form, writing themselves in as the recipient and using the 'Other' checkbox to specify a personal request.

red_flags: No patient self-access pathway — form is entirely oriented toward third-party disclosure with no 'personal request' option
Witness signature line present without clarification of whether it is required or optional
bright_spots: Bilingual form (English/Spanish) on a single document — meaningful accessibility for a Houston FQHC
Compact one-page-per-language design avoids discouraging patients

findability.rationale: Level 4: Easy to find with a basic web search returning a direct link, though the form is not linked from a clearly labeled patient resources page on the website.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 2: Primarily a paper workflow — the PDF has zero fillable fields and must be printed and handwritten; fax number is printed on the form providing an electronic submission path, but no digital form completion is possible.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: Adequate but with notable problems — compact and logically ordered, but checkbox mismatch between English and Spanish versions, grammatical errors, no instructions, and no delivery format options.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 2: Patient self-access is an afterthought — no 'personal request' checkbox, no 'send to me' option, no patient rights language, and no delivery preferences; the form is designed entirely for third-party disclosure.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: Some requirements that may go beyond what the law requires — ambiguous witness signature line, vague fee disclosure without HIPAA cost-based limits, and blanket sensitive-information consent that may not satisfy 42 CFR Part 2.

overall.summary: El Centro de Corazón provides an easily findable, compact bilingual form, but its generic third-party authorization design, non-fillable format, and lack of patient self-access pathway result in a below-average experience for patients requesting their own records.
